_header: While the hound gnaweth the bone
Bibliographic Ghosts: London, British Library Harley 3362: prosified version in this MS only, f. 5: “Whyl þe dogge gnawyth þe cat wold ete.”
_description: A proverbial saying about a dog with a bone not wishing any company — one couplet

CamTCC1149.Transcription: Wil þe hund gnagþ bonifere nele he non
